newsitem.title: UK: MAS flies last combi ex-UK, plans rate rise April.
newsitem.headline: MAS flies last combi ex-UK, plans rate rise April.

text.p: Malaysian Airline Systems Bhd flies its last Boeing 747 combi on Wednesday March 5 from London Heathrow replacing it with a passenger 747 with a reduced cargo capacity, an MAS executive said.
MAS is raising its ex-UK rates by between five and 20 percent from April one. Rates to Australia, New Zealand, Korea and Japan are scheduled to climb 15 percent, he added.
The passenger flights will be able to carry four pallets and five bins against 11 pallets and nine bins in the combi configuration.
No decisions have been taken on adding a pure freighter to the UK route but MAS does fly 747 freighters from both Amsterdam and Frankfurt.
-- Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+5017
